intro: Althaea pichleri, commonly known as the Pichler's marshmallow, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. Althaea pichleri is often found in wet meadows and marshy areas, thriving in moist, temperate climates.
